When I'm ready to go on behalf of fly from here I'm resuming my journey across the country sharing the good stories of our fellow Americans
This week I traveled to Buffalo New York along Lake Erie were the sky was cloaked in a constant gray missed allowing for just occasional peaks of the colorful leaves
The forecast with calling for the first snow fall of the year but for the good people of buffalo that's not even caused where a long sleeve shirt
When you live in Buffalo complaining about the weather is complaining about life itself
I was picked up at the airport by a woman named Charlie she's been driving for twenty two years and there have was filled with stuffed animals they lined the dashboard hung from the rear view mirror and the monkey was attached to the steering wheel
These are my co pilot she said some people have Jesus I have these guys she goes by Charlie because her father was hoping she'd be a boy I really think the name made me a bit of a tomboy when I was younger
They don't say tomboy anymore now everybody is filled with gender fluids
I guess I was ahead of my time but anyway I'm all girl now and everyone still calls me Charlie
After growing up in Buffalo she went to college down in Arizona because they want it to go to the hottest place I could find but it turns out I'm not built for the desert seems more like a place for lizards
People who stay there too long starting to look like a sponge that was left out in the sun she came home after school and it's been in Buffalo ever since we
Have a lot of moisture here and I love it I'm like a plant water me and I grow when it's not raining it's snowing and when it's not doing either we can count on in the midst from Niagara Falls are you here to see the falls

I answered what looked like one of the older bars in the city covered in lights and years assigned coasters stuck to the walls to kind of place where it's always midnight the kind of place that so tired that even the ceiling seems to be hunched over at the end of the bar
The bartender was a big bear of a man named Chris he had a giant beard and big pause and then grab while he worked
He says he's been in this bar for Thirty years and that he's been there so long he doesn't even smell they're famous buffalo wings any more people come in all the time and they say they smelled them all the way down the street but I don't smell a thing who knows maybe it's me they smell
